description.string: Investigate the five Platonic solids by displaying, rotating and resizing them. Select vertices, edges, and faces to show that the number of vertices minus the number of edges plus the number of faces is equal to 2 (Euler’s formula).

Bloom's taxonomy of the cognitive domain

entry.string: Students investigate the five Platonic solids.
Students demonstrate Euler’s formula by applying it to the Platonic solids.
Allows rotation and resizing of Platonic solids.
Supports repeated use through random generation of calculations of Euler's formula.
Allows students to manipulate 3-dimensional shapes to investigate a formula.
